facts: Taxpayer objects to federal spending on military programs
Taxpayer has no personal stake in the spending
Taxpayer shares concern with all other taxpayers
Taxpayer sues to enjoin the military spending
asp_facts: claim(c1). claim_type(c1, standing). plaintiff(c1, taxpayer). defendant(c1, federal_government). forum(c1, federal_court). injury_in_fact(c1, no). injury_concrete(c1, no). injury_particularized(c1, no). generalized_grievance(c1, yes). taxpayer_standing(c1, no).
question: Does the taxpayer have standing to challenge the spending?
rationale: A generalized grievance shared with all taxpayers does not confer standing. The taxpayer has no concrete, particularized injury distinct from the public at large. Courts do not adjudicate abstract policy disagreements.
